intro.title: About THINK Communication
intro.description: This exercise helps you practice thoughtful communication by considering if your approach is True, Helpful, Inspiring, Necessary, and Kind before engaging with others.

subsections.title: Choose someone you'll interact with today
subsections.prompt: Who will you practice THINK communication with? (family member, friend, colleague, etc.)
subsections.placeholder: Who will you practice THINK communication with? (family member, friend, colleague, etc.)

subsections.title: List 3-5 positive qualities about this person
subsections.prompt: What do you genuinely appreciate about them? Their kindness, humor, work ethic, creativity, etc.
subsections.placeholder: What do you genuinely appreciate about them? Their kindness, humor, work ethic, creativity, etc.

subsections.title: What conversation or interaction do you want to have?
subsections.prompt: What do you need to discuss? Is it a casual check-in, addressing an issue, or sharing something positive?
subsections.placeholder: What do you need to discuss? Is it a casual check-in, addressing an issue, or sharing something positive?

subsections.title: How will you apply THINK? (True, Helpful, Inspiring, Necessary, Kind)
subsections.prompt: Plan your THINK approach: Is what you'll say True? Will it be Helpful? Is it Inspiring? Is it Necessary? Will you communicate with Kindness?
subsections.placeholder: Plan your THINK approach: Is what you'll say True? Will it be Helpful? Is it Inspiring? Is it Necessary? Will you communicate with Kindness?

subsections.title: How did the conversation go? What happened?
subsections.prompt: Describe what happened during your interaction. How did you feel? What went well?
subsections.placeholder: Describe what happened during your interaction. How did you feel? What went well?

subsections.title: How did the other person respond to your THINK approach?
subsections.prompt: What was their reaction? Did they seem more open, relaxed, or positive? How did they engage with you?
subsections.placeholder: What was their reaction? Did they seem more open, relaxed, or positive? How did they engage with you?

subsections.title: What did you notice about the connection between you?
subsections.prompt: Did you feel closer? More understanding? Did the conversation flow better than usual?
subsections.placeholder: Did you feel closer? More understanding? Did the conversation flow better than usual?

subsections.title: What did you learn about communicating with THINK?
subsections.prompt: How did it feel to apply the THINK framework? What impact did your thoughtful approach have? What would you do differently next time?
subsections.placeholder: How did it feel to apply the THINK framework? What impact did your thoughtful approach have? What would you do differently next time?
